questions.stem: Which item helps prove your vehicle is legally allowed on public roads?
questions.explanation: A valid registration with correct address and displayed plates/stickers is required.

questions.stem: When buying or selling a vehicle, you must:

choices.text: Complete the title transfer according to state rules.
Keep the old title to save time.

questions.explanation: Title must be properly transferred to establish ownership.

choices.text: Renew registration on or before the due date.
Wait for a ticket before renewing.
Renew every five years regardless of notice.

questions.explanation: Timely renewal prevents fines or registration holds.

questions.stem: You must be able to show proof of financial responsibility:

choices.text: Only if driving out of state.

questions.explanation: Drivers must carry and present insurance (or other financial responsibility) proof upon request.

choices.text: Damage and injuries you cause to others.

questions.explanation: Liability coverage pays for othersâ€™ losses when you are at fault.

questions.stem: You must report a collision to the DMV and/or law enforcement when:

choices.text: It meets state thresholds (e.g., injury or qualifying property damage).
It occurs on private property only.
No one was around to see it.
It was just a minor scratch with no thresholds met.

questions.explanation: Report collisions according to state thresholds and timelines.

questions.stem: Which maintenance item is MOST critical for safe stopping?
questions.explanation: Brakes are essential to safety; keep them in good condition.

questions.stem: If a headlight burns out, you should:

choices.text: Replace it promptly; driving with defective lighting is unsafe and often illegal.
Ignore it; one headlight is enough.
Only drive during the day forever.

questions.explanation: Maintain required safety equipment to remain visible and legal.

questions.stem: At a minor collision with no injuries, the best action is to:

choices.text: Move vehicles out of traffic if safe, then exchange info.
Leave the cars where they are and block traffic.
Argue about fault in the lane.

questions.explanation: Clear travel lanes if safe to do so, then complete exchanges and documentation.

questions.stem: Which item should you exchange after a collision?

choices.text: Driver license number and insurance details.

questions.explanation: Exchange legal IDs, registration, and insurance information.

questions.stem: Driving without proof of required insurance can result in:

choices.text: Fines and other penalties per state law.

questions.explanation: States impose penalties for failing to show proof of financial responsibility.

choices.text: Reflective triangles, flashlight, first aid, water.

questions.explanation: Equip your vehicle to manage common roadside emergencies.
